Contract Type – Permanent<\u002Fp>\n <p> Working Hours – Full time<\u002Fp>\n <p> Closing Date – 27 January 2023<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Main Purpose of the Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> As a member of the Stations Operations and Maintenance Team, you will contribute towards delivering on the day to day maintenance and operational requirements to maximize the safe, reliable and commercial performance of the power station. Utilising your background knowledge and experience in the field of modern industrial Distributed Control Systems (DCS), your duties and responsibilities will include routine PPM, fault diagnosis and breakdown recovery. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The discipline Engineering team will provide direction and support as appropriate. You are required to effectively collaborate with Engineering &amp; Outage teams, supporting plant shutdowns and recommissioning. This post offers the opportunity to work flexibly in a site team environment and experience a wide range of maintenance and operations responsibilities to the delivery of the continuous improvement agenda and to maximise the flexibility and potential of the Station within the HC&amp;G UK portfolio. You will be expected to perform both maintenance and operational duties as required. This may require the need to work as part of a rotational or stagger shift pattern as the business needs change.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Health, Safety and Environmental compliance<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Meet both legislative and corporate requirements &amp; standards ensuring effective safety and operational practices are adopted<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the wider business targets, KPI’s and initiatives relating to health, safety, wellbeing and environment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Providing technical maintenance support for normal plant operations; breakdown &amp; defects management. Prioritising workload and available resources<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Implementing effective maintenance strategies; carrying out routine maintenance, core skill first line fault diagnosis and problem solving to ensure that the plant is maintained to appropriate standards and in accordance with RWE procedures.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Specify and procure spare parts in accordance with company policies, procedures and budget requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Management of outage work packages to ensure safe completion to the required quality and timescale.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Flexible working<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provide discipline support for plant breakdown and outage works inclusive of appropriate out of hours and weekend working to meet the needs of the business.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Implementing RWE &amp; OEM plant maintenance strategies<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ensuring all of the preventative maintenance work is carried out within the required timescales.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identification and monitoring of plant issues that could affect plant availability and reliability. Suggesting &amp; promoting modifications and continuous improvements.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Engaging with Contract staff, E&amp;O and specialist<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> DCE responsibilities - Involvement in the execution of maintenance contracts and on-site work - inclusive of craft &amp; contractor supervision. Planning, organizing, executing and where necessary supervising maintenance activities on the station. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b>Plant maintenance systems optimisation (e.g. PRISM). Developing the asset\u002Fplant history and status.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Updating and maintaining engineering discipline input into PRISM the stations CMMS. Developing and maintaining maintenance documentation, records and procedures.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> <b>Plant Operations<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Operator trained and accredited in line with station requirements to provide flexible shift operations.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Application of safe systems of work for self and appropriate contract &amp; craft personnel<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> RWE Generation UK - Safety Controller. Authorisation as required. Ensure that appropriate standards are being applied and adhered to by everyone in accordance with RWE’s rules and procedures.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Knowledge &amp; Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Hold an Engineering qualification in your discipline to the minimum level of HNC or ONC with relevant experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experienced in a wide range of discipline maintenance activities in heavy, process or power industry.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Have strong interpersonal skills and be competent in the use of applicable business IT systems such as Microsoft Office and have previous experience of a CMMS.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be a self-motivated, flexible individual able to work with the minimum of supervision, whilst being capable of providing support to the team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrable knowledge and experience of Health, Safety and Environmental legislation, regulations and directives.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Values and behaviours – developing the business culture through engagement and encouragement with all staff within their teams and wider portfolio. Flexible mind set willing to support the business working across the station &amp; wider portfolio; able to flex tasks, working hours and pattern to suit business needs. Ability and flexibility to retrain and to take on new skill sets.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> What we will offer you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> An expected starting salary from £42,225 to £49,677 depending on experience and up to 10% annual bonus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A personal retirement savings plan – if you put in 5% we will top up by a further 10% and you will get life assurance worth 4 x annual salary <\u002Fli>\n  <li>25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, pro-rata<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Company Paid Private Medical Insurance for you and your family <\u002Fli>\n  <li>One free professional membership subscription<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to flexible benefits such as Critical Illness, Dental Plan, Health Cash Plan, Share Incentive Plan, Cycle2Work, Electric Car Lease Scheme, Buy Additional Annual Leave and retail savings scheme<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Occupational Health support services for your wellbeing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to our employee assistance programme in times of need<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Up to 2 days volunteering a year<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> To view a preview of our benefits site ‘YourHub’ and see some of the other As one of the world’s leading generators of electricity from renewable energy sources, we aim to be carbon-neutral by 2040 and to enable a sustainable life for people around the world. To achieve this, we are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> RWE in the UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> We operate a large and diverse portfolio of power generation assets in the UK. We are the UK’s second largest generator of thermal flexible capacity, supplying around 10% of the UK’s electricity last year with 8.6GW of installed capacity. Contract Type – Permanent<\u002Fp>\n <p> Working Hours – Full Time<\u002Fp>\n <p> Closing Date – 1 February 2023<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Main Purpose of the Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Reporting to the site crafts-team supervisor, the Craftsperson (PC7) will be responsible for fault diagnosis, maintenance and repair of equipment across all areas of plant as well as carrying out routine maintenance activities. Working in an efficient and proactive manner, in accordance with RWE safety rules and procedures, you will require minimal Supervision. This is primarily a day working role but you must be prepared to provide cover outside normal working hours and to work shifts and weekends if required. <\u002Fp>\n <p>You should be aware that the role includes working in confined spaces, at heights and in <\u002Fp>\n <p>all weathers.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> In addition to maintenance duties there will be a requirement to support other sections, for example operations teams, storekeeping duties and general site duties as allocated.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Ensure the Power Station is a safe place to work and actively contribute to its safe, efficient and cost-effective running<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be responsible for the quality of your own work, recording of activities carried out,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> via the station’s computerised work management system (PRISM) and making<\u002Fli>\n  <li> recommendations for future activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that all safety and environmental issues are reported immediately<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work to a level of productivity in line with business requirements, whilst maintaining<\u002Fli>\n  <li> quality of work and taking pride in the highest standards of housekeeping during<\u002Fli>\n  <li> and at the end of your work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Undertake both routine and emergent maintenance activities relevant to the discipline as directed by chargehand or supervisor<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understand station process as required, for example stores, booking of spares, quality assurance systems, maintenance management systems etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Take a proactive approach to improvements to maintenance activities, and supporting station maintenance and operations as required<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work closely with maintenance engineers and technicians to resolve repeat or unusual defects<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Knowledge &amp; Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> A proactive and technically sound approach to Safety, Quality of Work and the achievement of Company and team Goals<\u002Fli>\n  <li><br> A positive and proactive team focused attitude<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A minimum of NVQ level 3 in an engineering discipline<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be Apprentice -trained with at least 1 years relevant experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Competence in the use of basic IT systems<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A high degree of self-reliance, self-motivation, self-confidence and working time flexibility<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The ability to make decisions in a pressurised environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The ability to develop good working relationships with those at all levels within the organisation<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Discipline Specific :<\u002Fp>\n <p> Electrical :<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Demonstrable experience on electrical equipment associated with heavy industry, including motors, switchgear (up to 6.6kV), actuators, battery and DC systems, hazardous area equipment, general electrical installations and fault investigation and diagnostics<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding of generators, excitation systems, and brush-gear including maintenance. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Understanding, knowledge and experience of DSEAR and ATEX regulations<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Control and Instrumentation :-<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Able to demonstrate experience and technical knowledge of state of the<\u002Fli>\n  <li> art control &amp; instrumentation equipment including level, pressure, flow, transmitters,<\u002Fli>\n  <li> actuators, chemical analysers etc.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> HMI, PLC experience and knowledge desirable<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pneumatic and hydraulic control valve set up and fault diagnosis, positioners and servos.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding, knowledge and experience of DSEAR and ATEX regulations, including the ability to train to COMPEX standards.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to work competently and reliably on safety instrumented systems, DCS systems and hazardous area equipment.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> What we will offer you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> An expected starting salary from £37,179 to £43,740 depending on experience and up to 10% annual bonus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A personal retirement savings plan – if you put in 5% we will top up by a further 10% and you will get life assurance worth 4 x annual salary <\u002Fli>\n  <li>25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, pro-rata<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Company Paid Private Medical Insurance for you and your family <\u002Fli>\n  <li>One free professional membership subscription<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to flexible benefits such as Critical Illness, Dental Plan, Health Cash Plan, Share Incentive Plan, Cycle2Work, Electric Car Lease Scheme, Buy Additional Annual Leave and retail savings scheme<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Occupational Health support services for your wellbeing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to our employee assistance programme in times of need<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Up to 2 days volunteering a year<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> To To achieve this, we are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> RWE in the UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> We operate a large and diverse portfolio of power generation assets in the UK. Delivering RWE’s “Growing Green” strategy, we work across the entire project lifecycle with expertise in plant design, construction, operation and optimization.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Main purpose of the Role:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The mechanical engineering department of RWE Technology International GmbH is a mixed team with experts from various disciplines from Balance of Plant over boilers, turbines, HVAC and building technologies to hydrogen electrolysers. We are involved in various national and international Power2X and X2Power building projects and cover all project phases, from project development to turnkey handover. This includes new construction projects for hydrogen-ready power plants, hydrogen electrolysers, LNG and ammonia terminals.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Key of plant as well as carrying out routine maintenance activities and general site duties as allocated.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Working in an efficient and proactive manner, in accordance with the station’s computerised work management system (PRISM) and making recommendations for future activities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that all safety and environmental issues are reported immediately<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work to a high level of productivity in line with business requirements, whilst maintaining quality of work and taking pride in the highest standards of housekeeping during and at the end of your work<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Undertake both routine and emergent maintenance activities relevant to the discipline as directed by the station O&amp;M team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lynn<\u002Fp>\n <p> Contract Type – Permanent<\u002Fp>\n <p> Working Hours – Full time<\u002Fp>\n <p> Closing Date – 01 February 2023<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Main Purpose of the Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> This role will focus on continuous improvement activities on site and within the wider RWE. In order to continually adapt and change for the market conditions this role will be leading the completion of O&amp;M Projects to improve station performance. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The main focus of the role will be on the delivery of projects which may be related to plant &amp; process, so may be simple tasks such as process documentation production, leading plant installation projects such as new equipment installations and also assisting with and involved with outage planning and execution. <\u002Fp>\n <p>It is expected that this role will be influential in station performance, receiving information from various sources (internally and externally) to determine potential projects, communicating with RWE expertise and contractors to determine the best solution to implement and working with the site team to execute the project. Projects may be of any nature as long as its been determined by the site to be priority and value adding. <\u002Fp>\n <p>The other focus of the role will to support the Operations &amp; Maintenance team through Training and Development. The role will provide Safety Rules training to the team on site and provide Training to both Operations and Maintenance to enable the Cross skilling to occur. There will also be times when other members of the team will be released for project work and this role will lead and support this individual. <\u002Fp>\n <p>This is a key role within the site that has the ability to influence and drive the performance and culture on site with regard to improvements, Competency &amp; standards on site. There will also be occasions whereby the role will be involved with Outage Planning and Execution and also supporting the Operations &amp; Maintenance team in activities such as Work Management. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Health, Safety and Environmental compliance<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Support the Sections heads in assuring that all legislative and corporate requirements &amp; standards are adopted.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assure that all operational &amp; maintenance and engineering plant, equipment and process safety policies &amp; procedures are complied with.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Assure that the Local and Business Targets (KPIS) are supported and delivered.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Project Delivery<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Support the Section Heads in the leading and management of Operations &amp; Maintenance performance.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Deliver projects from concept to delivery using the agreed methodology of execution.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Utilise Operational and plant knowledge to continuously improvement methods of work.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Outage Support<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Assist with outage planning and execution involving both local site teams and RWE OPD teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide flexibility during the outage to support others. <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Continuous improvement<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Review of on site processes leading to implementation of continuous improvement processes across the site (HSE, Plant, Process, People)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Interface with other sites and teams for best practices and with agreement of the management team lead the implementation of them on site.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Operations &amp; Maintenance Support<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Fully Competent in station operations &amp; Maintenance Processes<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Knowledge &amp; Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Leadership qualities <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Able to make informed decisions and set the high standards of working on site &amp; RWE. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to engage and influence others to align and focus on an output and timescales <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>Management qualities <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Experience of organising and managing project works. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience in delivering improvements with clear defined goals <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Manage their own time and others in terms of managing the execution of the works and deliverables <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to manage team tasks through effective delegation and tracking. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to ensure that team members feel empowered and supported into making the right decisions and delivering what is needed.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Personal: <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Demonstrates the ability to deal with constantly changing priorities. Attention to detail is essential; methodical, innovative, numerate, analytical and well organised.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in Station operations and plant performance. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>High level of awareness of Safety &amp; Environmental <\u002Fli>\n  <li>A number of years experience (10yrs) within the industry with similar skills. Ideally with formal training\u002Fskills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preferable trained in continuous improvement techniques. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Thorough understanding of the RWE HC&amp;G UK business strategy and how it adds value to the Business Plan.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Possess sound knowledge on power generation safety management systems including system Safety Rules.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrable knowledge and experience of Health, Safety and Environmental legislation, regulations and directives<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> What we offer our people:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> An expected starting salary from £47,199 to £62,913 depending on experience and up to 15% annual bonus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A personal retirement savings plan – if you put in 5% we will top up by a further 10% and you will get life assurance worth 4 x annual salary <\u002Fli>\n  <li>25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, pro-rata<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Company Paid Private Medical Insurance for you and your family <\u002Fli>\n  <li>One free professional membership subscription<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to flexible benefits such as Critical Illness, Dental Plan, Health Cash Plan, Share Incentive Plan, Cycle2Work, Electric Car Lease Scheme, Buy Additional Annual Leave and retail savings scheme<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Occupational Health support services for your wellbeing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to our employee assistance programme in times of need<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Up to 2 days volunteering a year<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> To view a preview of our benefits site ‘YourHub’ and see some of the Please contact us to request accommodation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Our energy for a sustainable life<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. RWE Technology<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. As one of the world’s leading generators of electricity from renewable energy source, we aim to be carbon-neutral by 2040 and to enable a sustainable life for our people around the world. We are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> RWE Technology manage projects with innovative solutions for energy decarbonization. Delivering RWE’s “Growing Green” strategy, we work across the entire project lifecycle with expertise in plant design, construction, operation and optimization. Our projects include blue and green hydrogen production, grid support technologies, grid scale battery storage, plant conversion, carbon capture and storage, amongst a host of others.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Role Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> This is an exciting opportunity to join RWE Technology UK. You will be a key member in a team of project managers based in the UK and part of an international team, providing co-ordination and management for energy projects, both in development and implementation, on behalf of the wider RWE business and external clients.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Key Deliverables<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Establishment and management of project teams including management of technical scope, personnel interfaces and stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Safe delivery of project management services for design, permit and consenting processes, cost, risk and schedule planning, contract specification, negotiation and award, ensuring project delivery and handover to safety, time, cost and quality objectives. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Development, implementation, monitoring and controlling of projects for internal and external customers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Follow RWE internal processes to deliver projects in safety, time, cost, scope, quality <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Preparation and delivery of project execution plans including safety management, schedule and budgets, project goals &amp; objectives, roles, responsibilities, interfaces &amp; risk management. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Control and monitor projects to ensure milestones are achieved and risks are identified &amp; mitigated.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation and presentation of project progress reports, monitor and forecast RWE Technology International resource usage in projects<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Your powerful experience &amp; skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> University degree or equivalent in energy-related field of engineering or project management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Several years of experience and a solid track record as a project (technical) manager in the energy, infrastructure, construction or oil and gas industries<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good knowledge of current UK health, safety and environmental legislation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong organisational and problem solving skills. Kings Lynn<\u002Fp>\n <p> Contract Type – Permanent <\u002Fp>\n <p>Working Hours – Full time<\u002Fp>\n <p> Closing Date – 23 January 2023<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Main Purpose of the Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Utilising your background knowledge and experience in the field of Mechanical Engineering, specifically in Heat Recovery Steam Generators (HRSG), Cooling water systems, Power transmission systems and other Auxiliary plant and systems common in heavy industry, you will be expected to provide a high level of asset specific technical knowledge and competence within discipline area to the Operations and Maintenance team. Supporting the technicians in order to deliver challenging operational, technical and commercial targets. Maintain plant area knowledge and expertise within maintenance discipline ensuring risk based maintenance techniques are applied to deliver safe, flexible and reliable plant.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Health, Safety &amp; Environmental compliance:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Meet both legislative and corporate requirements &amp; standards ensuring effective safety and operational practices are adopted<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Take ownership of maintenance compliance of plant and equipment policies &amp; procedures within discipline area.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the wider GCU targets and initiatives relating to health, safety, wellbeing and environment, Including Mission Zero, NWoW &amp; Business KPIs <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Ensure operational process safety compliance of plant and equipment<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Develop robust risk based maintenance processes to deliver the Commercial Performance of the asset:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Manage stakeholder interfaces<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Maintain regular communication and continued collaboration and cooperation with E&amp;O technical specialists and the Operations Team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the Operations Team in delivering the Asset commercial targets.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop \u002F enhance Local Maintenance Strategies with E&amp;O to deliver on the agreed Asset Strategy.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Balance the demands of short-term minimisation of maintenance costs with the longer term performance and life expectancy of assets.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide discipline technical support to the Maintenance technicians.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support transition to Operator\u002F Maintainer, Maintainer\u002F Operator flexibility.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Budget management and cost control:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Develop the asset medium term maintenance budgets for specified discipline plant areas.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure station maintenance expenditure is within approved budgets and plans, and effective management of resources<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Effectively prioritise and optimise maintenance, and ensure that processes are in place to provide support and delivery appropriately.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure that maintenance contracts are commercially optimised in accordance with GCU guidelines.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Engender a culture of innovation to ensure that business performance is continuously improved, including identifying areas where the power plant staff can learn from practices in place within wider RWE Generation portfolio:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Decision making, including balancing short term commercial performance against controllable costs and the long term integrity of the asset.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop the capability of the asset to deliver optimum commercial performance.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Management of Staff, Competence and Support<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Location – Ferrybridge<\u002Fp>\n <p> Contract Type – Permanent<\u002Fp>\n <p> Working Hours – Full time<\u002Fp>\n <p> Closing Date – 31 January 2023<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Main Purpose of the Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Reporting to the Resource Management Lead the role is responsible for coordination of E&amp;O resource demand ensuring priorities are understood and met both in year and over the mid-term plan to allow effective deployment. Ensuring resources are assigned at the right time to allow planning, delivery and close out of major maintenance, repair and other projects across the portfolio. Developing and maintaining supplier relationships to ensure external resource options are available to meet peaks in demand.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Working with the relevant stakeholders across the business to ensure that the resource with the correct competency and capability are identified and allocated as required for projects to ensure that safety requirements are met.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensuring competency maintenance requirements are identified, planned and completed as required for all craft and supervision resource.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all Project resourcing activities for E&amp;O are completed in line with business demands. Developing and maintaining strong relations with senior stakeholders to ensure successful timely delivery of resources.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting strategic decision making by identifying resourcing risks and constraints.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure appropriate Performance Management of both internal resources via senior stakeholder management and external resources via agreed performance mechanisms (KPI’s)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the Contracts and Commercial Management Team with the business planning process and by providing effective financial management and control of Agency budgets ensuring effective costs control, forecasting and financial tracking is in place, identify and mitigate resourcing risks. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Support the drive for resource optimisation across the Business to reduce external spend.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify future competency gaps and support the development resourcing options.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure effective resourcing of the business prioritises through strong management of both internal and external key stakeholders. Address known resourcing risks and identify resourcing opportunities to improve on plan. Work with MSF’s to ensure support requirements are understood and delivered in line with expectations. Own the interface with key agency providers and develop and maintain relationships with key service providers.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Champion a culture of continuous improvement. Promote and lead improvement projects across the Business<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Knowledge &amp; Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Experience of resource management across large complex multi-disciplined teams . Has the ability to influence Managers from across the business providing clear information and justification for resource placement and utilisation. Will challenge areas where portfolio resourcing is sub-optimal.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> HNC\u002Fdegree qualification or equivalent experience.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrates the ability to deal with constantly changing priorities. Attention to detail is essential; methodical, innovative, numerate, analytical and well organised.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrable knowledge and experience of Health, Safety and Environmental legislation, regulations and directives<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Values and behaviours – developing the business culture through engagement and encouragement with all staff within their teams and wider portfolio<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of working across a geographical diverse portfolio with strong stakeholder management &amp; proven effective communication skills. A strong influencing skill set to ensure effective delivery of role objectives.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> High level knowledge of the wider power generation process and how their discipline fits, not just technically but also from a process safety, operational and commercial perspective.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> This role will require the successful candidate to undergo a National Security Vetting Check from the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy. Further information can be found on the gov.uk advice page here. For SC level clearance, BEIS require a minimum of 5 years residency in the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> What we will offer you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> An expected starting salary sub-division of RWE Supply and Trading based in Swindon comprising a team of around 60 people who work at the interface between RWE Renewables, RWE Generation and the Trading business. The role available is that of a Commercial Support Analyst. The successful candidate will work in the Commercial Asset Management Renewables team in the optimisation of the RWE Renewables UK &amp; Ireland portfolio, managing Off shore and Onshore Assets as well as the integration of Solar and Batteries into the portfolio <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Your responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Supporting commercial strategies for the Renewables portfolio including forward hedging and Ancillary Services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Continuous enhancement of the Renewables forecasting processes; minimising forecast error, bias removal, ensembles and blending<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting the commercial set-up of new build assets in the UK and Ireland and registration \u002F entry into new services e.g. capacity markets and ancillary services<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Your powerful skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Educated to degree standard or equivalent and demonstrate the ability to deal with constantly changing priorities in a fast moving environment whilst maintaining attention to detail <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Able to demonstrate a good understanding of weather\u002Fpower forecasting methodologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Competent in data analysis techniques <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Have the ability to comprehend complex information and translate into understandable written and illustrative material<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> What we value most is curiosity, ambition, resilience and authenticity. <p> Contract Type – Permanent<\u002Fp>\n <p> Working Hours – Full Time<\u002Fp>\n <p> Closing Date – 20 January 2023<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Who is RWE?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE Generation is responsible for power generation with gas, hard coal, hydrogen, hydropower and biomass. Our approximately 3,000 employees operate power plants in Germany, Great Britain, the Netherlands and Turkey.<\u002Fp>\n <p> With our flexible, efficient power plant fleet, we are building the bridge for the path to the age of renewable energies. RWE Generation ranks 2nd in Europe with its gas fleet. An excellent starting position: Gas is becoming increasingly important as a bridge to the regenerative age.<\u002Fp>\n <p> In the UK, RWE is one of the largest power producers and a leading renewable generator supplying around 15% of UK electricity with a diverse operational portfolio of onshore wind, offshore wind, hydro, biomass and gas, amounting to over 9.3GW.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> What is Engineering &amp; Outage?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The Engineering &amp; Outage division in RWE Generation Gas is responsible for central engineering services to our Gas Power Stations across Europe in addition to determine the scope of a major outage and large investment projects. Services and projects covers the whole Power Station be this the Gas Turbine, Steam Turbine, Heat Recovery Steam Generator, Electrical Generator, Civil Infrastructure, Control &amp; Instrumental Systems and even the important auxiliary systems such as Cooling Towers, Pumps and Valves all integral for safe, flexible and reliable operation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Role Location – Swindon or UK Gas Power Site (travel through-out the UK expected)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE’s Mechanical &amp; Materials is an international team in Engineering &amp; Outage we want to strengthen our core static mechanical engineering competence to deliver engineering services in the UK. You will be a focused individual who can co-ordinate several work streams and can keep stakeholders informed. You will also share your experience with your German and Dutch civil colleagues where appropriate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You would join a friendly team of around 20 professional engineers\u002Fscientists, with varying backgrounds including mechanical engineering, materials\u002Fmetallurgy, physics, civil engineering and chemistry. The team work collaboratively and support each other to meet the exciting challenge of keeping our gas-fired power plant reliable and efficient. This supports RWE’s goal of being carbon neutral by 2040. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join our team to contribute to a sustainable energy transition and shape the UK’s low carbon flexible landscape.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Main Purpose of the Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Your role is to provide mechanical engineering expertise to the RWE gas power station fleet. You will be responsible for technical delivery of projects and tasks, resolving emergent technical issues and contribute to meeting UK Pressure Systems Safety Regulations (PSSR) requirements through the Technical Review process. You will be conscientious, self-motivated and enthusiastic.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Your safety behaviours will be exemplary and you will develop the capability to work to independently and take individual responsibility for your technical decisions. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Implementation of consistent HRSG and BOP engineering and maintenance strategies to deliver portfolio performance in line with individual asset strategies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Produce Technical Reviews to support PSSR requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop outage scope and assist in delivery at site.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Undertake supporting projects for effective component life management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Co-ordinate tasks with gas power plant operational sites.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Knowledge &amp; Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Degree or suitable alternative in Mechanical Engineering. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Chartered Engineer or actively progressing towards Chartered status.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Effective at stakeholder management to maintain proactive working relationships.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of heat recovery steam generators and balance of plant engineering issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstration of complex thinking , including both analytical and conceptual skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Organisation and planning abilities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to use analysis tools (e.g. plant data analysis, root cause analysis, design tools)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sound written and verbal communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Use of standard Microsoft software including Excel.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> What we will offer you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> An expected starting salary from £47k to £60k depending on experience and up to 15% annual bonus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A personal retirement savings plan – if you put in 5% we will top up by a further 10% and you will get life assurance worth 4 x annual salary <\u002Fli>\n  <li>25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, pro-rata<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Company Paid Private Medical Insurance for you and your family <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Free access to our on-site gym facilities and classes <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Free parking (including electric vehicle charging points)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Subsidised canteen facilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> One free professional membership subscription<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to flexible benefits such as Critical Illness, Dental Plan, Health Cash Plan, Share Incentive Plan, Cycle2Work, Electric Car Lease Scheme, Buy Additional Annual Leave and retail savings scheme<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Occupational Health support services for your wellbeing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to our employee assistance programme in times of need<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Up to 2 days volunteering a year<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> To view a preview of our benefits site ‘YourHub’ and see some of the other benefits we have on offer please visit https:\u002F\u002Fwww.edenred.co.uk\u002Fcampaigns\u002Frwe-yourhub\u002Findex.html<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Working at RWE<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> To find out more about what it’s like to work at one of Europe’s largest energy companies and what we are all about we have a wealth of information on our Careers pages. https:\u002F\u002Fwww.rwe.com\u002Fen\u002Frwe-careers-portal orientation and identity.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Our energy for a sustainable life<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. As one of the world’s leading generators of electricity from renewable energy sources, we aim to be carbon-neutral by 2040 and to enable a sustainable life for people around the world. To achieve this, we are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> RWE in the UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> We operate a large and diverse portfolio of power generation assets in the UK. We are the UK’s second largest generator of thermal flexible capacity, supplying around 10% of the UK’s electricity last year with 8.6GW of installed capacity. <p><b>RWE Supply &amp; Trading GmbH, Swindon<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The Commodity Accounting team is responsible for producing RWE Supply &amp; Trading GmbH’s (RWEST) monthly financial accounts for commodities traded in the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p> RWEST provides the interface between RWE and energy markets around the globe. Around 1,700 employees from over 50 countries are engaged in the trade of electricity, gas, commodities and carbon emission certificates. The trading company is also responsible for commercial asset optimisation at RWE, operates natural gas storage facilities and markets green electricity produced by RWE Renewables. In addition to physical and derivative commodities, the trading portfolio comprises emissions certificates, freight, weather derivatives and biomass. RWE Supply &amp; Trading offers major industrial companies and trading partners trading-based portfolio management, long-term supply concepts and risk management solutions. <\u002Fp>\n <p>As the successful candidate you will be required to work with Front and Back Offices, Risk and Controlling to develop a good commercial understanding of the business activities within RWEST. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Your responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> On a monthly basis reconcile IAS results with the Risk department’s monthly P&amp;L reports and work to resolve\u002Fexplain issues or differences.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Present and explain financial results to Risk, Controlling and the wider Accounting teams.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Reconcile and analyse key balance sheet accounts and prepare commentary.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review control environment to ensure integrity of information leaving the team.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to develop, nurture and manage close relationships across the business and in multiple locations.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare ad-hoc management reports, carry out project work as required and respond to specific questions or requests as appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Prepare information for, and respond to, audit queries.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify and implement improvements to the reporting process.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Your profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Qualified accountant (ACA\u002F ACMA\u002F ACCA) with 3 years post qualified experience. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Excellent analytical skills. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Have a questioning and inquisitive mind with a proven ability to challenge and revise processes as required.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be a strong communicator and possess an ability to develop trusting and credible relationships at all levels of the business and across various teams.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible and comfortable working under time pressure to meet deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Advanced excel skills are essential.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong IT skills, and knowledge of Access databases desirable.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of using SAP would be advantageous.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to travel to other RWEST locations as required.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Our offer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Great work life balance and team athmosphere<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Competitive <p><b>RWE Supply &amp; Trading GmbH, Swindon<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Commercial Asset Optimisation UK (CAO-UK) is a sub-division of RWE Supply and Trading based in Swindon comprising a team of around 60 people who work at the interface between RWE Renewables, RWE Generation and the Trading business. The role available is that of a Commercial Manager. The successful candidate will work in the Commercial Asset Management Renewables team in the optimisation of the RWE Renewables UK &amp; Ireland portfolio, managing Off shore and Onshore Assets as well as the integration of Solar and Batteries into the portfolio <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Your responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li><b> Contract Management:<\u002Fb> (day-to-day operational activities): Manage offtake contracts \u002F Provide Energy Management Services for JVs and Oversee the settlement apportionment allocation<\u002Fli>\n  <li><b> Certificate Hedging\u002FTrading\u002FMarket Access Management:<\u002Fb> Develop and execute (after approval from relevant committees) deviation strategies, Monitor reference hedge path, Discuss with market access provider if liquidity constraints appear, Screen market trends \u002F Specify terms for route-to-market agreements \u002F Monitor and improve performance \u002F Develop new market access is the interface between the RWE Group’s operating companies and global wholesale markets for energy and energy-related raw materials and is a leading European energy trading house.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We as “Central Services” Team are positioned within RWEST IT with our team members located across Essen (Germany) and Swindon (UK).<\u002Fp>\n <p> We are heading towards DevOps transformation journey with forming different SQUADS within the team. As a central team our work horizon ensures different applications support, analysing systems (ETRM , RISK etc), researches problems, maintenance, coordination, cloud native and development of Inhouse and external application tools in energy market. We offer our support to different IT Embedded teams and also Business users \u002F Traders to ensure smooth running of energy trading systems.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Provides operations support by with Openlink - ENDUR and ensuring the end of day data \u002F workflows management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Gather specific requirements from business and embedded IT teams to provide solutions via working in incidents and service requests<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordination and work closely with business and IT stakeholders in quick issue resolutions in the context of an Incident Management, Problem enhancements and coordination<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide Initial Bug Fixes, Change Requests and enhancements for different applications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Readiness in shift rotations with 24*7 oncall Permanent<\u002Fp>\n <p> Working Hours – Full Time<\u002Fp>\n <p> Closing Date – On receipt of sufficient applications<\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE Technology<\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. As one of the world’s leading generators of electricity from renewable energy sources, we aim to be carbon-neutral by 2040 and to enable a sustainable life for our people around the world. We are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future. RWE Technology manages projects with innovative solutions for energy decarbonisation. Delivering RWE’s “Growing Green” strategy, we work across the entire project lifecycle with expertise in plant design, construction, operation and optimization. <\u002Fp>\n <p>This is an exciting opportunity to join RWE Technology UK. We are looking for talented electrical engineers including a senior electrical engineer and individuals with specialist electrical engineering knowledge to be key members of a growing team of specialists based in the UK and part of a wider international team, providing engineering services for energy decarbonisation across the project lifecycle. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fp>\n <p> As an RWE Technology UK electrical engineer you will join a team delivering multiple projects across energy decarbonisation technologies. Our projects include blue and green hydrogen production, grid support &amp; restoration technologies, grid scale battery storage, plant conversions, carbon capture and storage and combined cycle power plants amongst a host of others.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Location will be agile, dependent on task or project. You will be responsible for ensuring the technical development &amp; delivery of projects and tasks. These are a broad roles including specification and assessment of contract scopes, system modelling, grid connection applications &amp; compliance assessment, technical problem solving and quality assurance through manufacturing &amp; construction. You will be responsible for prioritising your own workload and managing individual work packages, utilising the internal and external resources as necessary. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Your know-how &amp; commitment will deliver project deliverables including:<\u002Fp>\n <p> <\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Planning, scoping and delivery of electrical projects and project packages<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Conceptional design of main and auxiliary power supply networks and electrical components in the sectors of battery energy storage, hydrogen generation and electrical power generation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Coordination of grid connection process with national and district network grid operators<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Design &amp; simulation of electrical networks including fault level management; earthing, power &amp; load flows, protection discrimination; arc flash studies etc. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Evaluation of electrical equipment for grid connected assets and operational plant <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Development of optimisation measures for plant operation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Preparation of technical specifications, contract tender documents, bid review and evaluation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Technical project management of electrotechnical work scopes, interface management, quality control of detailed planning and manufacturing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supervision of assembly and commissioning<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Knowledge &amp; Skills<\u002Fp>\n <p> You will have<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Batchelor Degree or equivalent in electrical engineering<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Several years of professional experience in electrical engineering and construction of large-scale projects or, plant operational maintenance in the power industry or relevant process industry <\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p>We are seeking to recruit individuals with a range of skills which may include:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> In-depth process knowledge of electrical power systems including generation, BESS, protection systems, switchgear, transformers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Proficiency in power system modelling and associated software tools. A working understanding of DIgSILENT PowerFactory is desirable.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Existing knowledge of hydrogen electrolyser projects <\u002Fli>\n  <li>General knowledge in the field of decentralized electricity generation and storage and their behaviour on the grid<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Good knowledge of current UK health, safety and environmental legislation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong organisational and problem solving skills. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Good communication and interpersonal capabilities as well as <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Good Negotiation skills<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Willingness to travel in the country and abroad<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Advantage, not a must<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Chartered Engineer Status<\u002Fli>\n  <li> of gender, disability, nationality, ethnic and social background, religion and beliefs, age or sexual orientation and identity.<\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. We build full-stack, tailor-made IT solutions to help traders optimise our fleet of power stations and quickly spot market opportunities. All of this is achieved using DevOps delivery processes and the latest technologies. Our goal is the fastest possible delivery cycle while maintaining the highest possible quality standards. We can only achieve this with the very best people!<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Your responsibilities <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Take full ownership to design, implement and maintain robust bespoke applications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be user focused, working to understand and maximise the business value of the solution that is being developed<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be technology focussed, keeping up to date with the latest cloud technologies, identifying where and how these technologies can be utilised<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work with an agile methodology delivering solutions through DevOps<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Think creatively to ensure immediate business goals are satisfied, while long-term success of the solution is also achieved. We never stop looking for continuous improvement opportunities and ways to reduce technical debt.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work collaboratively with the team to define our technology strategy for the future and share best practice with other teams in IT and the business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You must be willing to participate in standby\u002Fon-call rota and willing to travel occasionally<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Your profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Demonstrable C#.Net development experience working at senior level<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Architecture\u002Fdesign patterns, distributed systems, SOLID principles<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Good knowledge of continuous integration\u002Fdelivery methodology and tools<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Oracle or Postgres\u002FDynamoDb databases<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Practical experience using Agile (Scrum\u002FKanban) methodologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability and willingness to learn new skills rapidly within a commercial environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Act as a point of reference, coaching and training less experienced developers<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong customer focus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluency in English (both verbal and written)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Advantageous, but not a must <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Experience with AWS \u002F Cloud technologies <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Experience with Containers, Docker, Kubernetes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of re-architecting traditional systems to cloud specific technologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Practical experience of automated testing, TDD\u002FBDD<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> What we value most is curiosity, ambition, resilience and authenticity. <p><b>RWE Supply &amp; Trading GmbH, Swindon<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Back Office are responsible the trade lifecycle management of all deals concluded by our Commodity Traders. This includes sending out deal confirmations, managing margin and collateral payments, controlling balancing group accounts, sending out invoices and settling deals. While performing these tasks, we are responsible for providing a comprehensive and quality checked control within the trade lifecycle process across Front Office, Back Office, Risk, Finance, Accounting and Legal.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We have a diverse commodity portfolio including power, gas emission certificates, renewables – wind, hydro and batteries, LNG, freight, weather and biomass. The Company is also responsible for the commercial optimisation of RWE’s entire asset business and offers large industrial companies and trading partners trading-based portfolio management, long-term supply contracts and risk management solutions.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We have a position available to join our Bespoke UK Team based in Swindon. This team is responsible for playing an integral part in securing income for the wide range of assets held within our renewable portfolio. This is managed through day to day operation of contracts, managing relationships with Counterparties &amp; Market Operators whilst being closely interlinked with our Commercial Asset Optimisation team<\u002Fp>\n <p> Does the above grab your attention? Then join RWE Supply &amp; Trading as a Back Office specialist.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Your responsibilities <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>The primary focus of the role is to perform operational activities independently and apply knowledge and skills in a wide variety of contexts. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Daily operational activities include:\n   <ul>\n    <li> Calculating, Validating, Analysing &amp; Reporting the incomes of our generating assets (Whether wholly owned or as part of a Joint Venture)<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Accurate and timely Power settlement according to a different set of factors including technology type, subsidy mechanism, grid connection and contract method<\u002Fli>\n    <li> In addition to Power, settlement calculations for Imbalances, Curtailment and Green Certificates<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Validating data and resolving queries from Meter Data Collection Services, and windfarms\u002Fsites to ensure metered output correlates to benefits received i.e. Renewable Obligation Certificates etc <\u002Fli>\n    <li>Bespoke enquiries from JV \u002F Stakeholders and effective relationship management<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to challenge up stream as and when required, and escalating appropriately<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Representing the team in projects and handling non-operational tasks, including key contract information sharing and stakeholder management<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Can deal with new unique\u002Fcomplex issues or challenges and can structure and document these so that other team members can take over<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Pro-actively identifying process improvements and driving these forward within the team, closely liaising with stakeholders and developers<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Your profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Track record for driving and implementing process improvements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent communication skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Must be driven, be a catalyst for change<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Degree educated or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Intermediate Excel skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent problem solving skills, agile approach to challenges<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Advantageous, but not a must<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Experience of Power &amp; Certificates Settlement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Understanding of transmission, balancing and market systems and services<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Development of new products in collaboration with senior team members and other parts of the business<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Our offer <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>A job at RWE Supply &amp; Trading gives you the opportunity to join one of Europe’s leading energy trading houses. Within Back Office you will gain a thorough understanding of RWEST’s trading portfolio and work closely with many other departments supporting the trade lifecycle. We offer the opportunity to travel to our headquarters in Essen, Germany and sometimes even further afield. Once you have spent some time with us, your knowledge will have vastly developed and you will have influenced projects to help the team and business succeed. &amp; Trading are responsible for processing deals after they have been concluded by the commodity trading desks. This includes sending out deal confirmations, managing margin and collateral payments, controlling balancing group accounts as well as sending out invoices and settling deals. While performing these tasks, we are responsible for providing a comprehensive and quality checked control within the trade lifecycle process across Front Office, Back Office, Risk, Finance, Accounting and Legal - close cooperation with these ares are key.<\u002Fp>\n <p> We have a diverse commodity portfolio including power, gas emission certificates, renewables, LNG, freight, weather and biomass. Without Back Office as the operational backbone of the trading business, nothing would work!<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> Do you have a keen eye for detail? Have you worked in a Finance\u002FProcurement or Settlements role and have experience in a fast changing environment? We currently have 3 open vacancies in our Cargo, Freight and Renewables\u002FBespoke contract teams therefore if you're passionate about these subjects, don't hesitate to submit your application!<br> with meticulous attention to detail and limited operational risk to the business<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Responsible for checking the trades captured in Endur<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Settlement of contracts according to contractual timeframes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Mentoring less experienced colleagues<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Deal with most of the new, unique issues or challenges and can structure and document energy and energy-related raw materials and is a leading European energy trading house.<\u002Fp> \n  <p>We as “Central Services” Team are positioned within RWEST IT with our team members located across Essen (Germany) and Swindon (UK).<\u002Fp> \n  <p>We are heading towards DevOps transformation journey with forming different SQUADS within the team. As a central team our work horizon ensures different applications support, analysing systems (ETRM , RISK etc), researches problems, maintenance, coordination, cloud native and development of Inhouse and external application tools in energy market. We offer our support to different IT Embedded teams and also Business users \u002F Traders to ensure smooth running of energy trading systems.<\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Provides operations support by analysing systems, researching problems and maintenance \u002F coordination of different applications<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Continuous improvements of processes through e.g. innovative ideas, enhance via working in incidents and service requests<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Coordination and work closely with business and IT stakeholders in quick issue resolutions in the context of an Incident Management, enhancements and coordination<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Provide Initial Bug Fixes, Change Requests and enhancements for different applications<\u002Fli> \n   <li>Readiness in shift rotations with 24*7 oncall and occasional travel required<\u002Fli> \n  <\u002Ful> \n  <p><b>Your powerful skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n  <ul>\n   <li>Basic knowledge in ETRM domain and experience in ENDUR across different areas such as Cloud, Data, Networks, EUC and Service Management.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Take responsibility for managing suppliers and drive successful contract implementation throughout the contract Contract Type – Permanent<\u002Fp>\n <p> Working Hours – Full Time<\u002Fp>\n <p> Closing Date – 27 January 2023<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Main Purpose of the Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE Technology UK Limited is looking for 2 Senior Estates Surveyors, to join its two dedicated property teams.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> The Property Management &amp; Site Development team is responsible for all aspects of property management and site development of the RWE Generation property portfolio within the UK and Europe. RWE Generation has a wide ranging portfolio of operational and other sites throughout the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> The Senior Estate Surveyor will provide professional property consultancy advice and assistance on operational and non-operational property management relating to the RWE Generation property portfolio in the UK. They will be responsible for managing a significant and diverse estate ranging from land and non-operational buildings on operational and surplus, reserve or closed former operational sites as well as the taking and granting of various commercial lettings and other rights and interests in land throughout the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> The Real Estate team is responsible for the management of the UK office &amp; workshop portfolio on behalf of the RWE group companies. RWE currently operates in a number of locations in the UK, including a recently refurbished office headquarters in Swindon, Wiltshire. Other significant sites include prime offices in London and Coventry. This new role will be responsible for managing part of the Renewables portfolio which is currently expanding throughout the UK.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> The Senior Estates Surveyor will deal with commercial property management relating to all RWE group companies in the UK. They will be responsible for managing a significant and diverse estate of offices, workshops and operational buildings. The granting of various short term commercial lettings, Service Level Agreements &amp; day to day estate management. They will play a key role in managing small refurbishment projects and enhancing the portfolio as it develops and establishes.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Freehold &amp; Leasehold Land &amp; Property management - Accountable for proactively managing RWE properties in line with property law and RICS standards <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Management of diverse portfolio in accordance with UK law, RICS standards, H&amp;S and environmental best practice<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Professional property strategy advice and services in terms of property\u002Fland, divestment including demolition projects (Property Management &amp; Site Development Team only)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Supporting new projects in relation to acquisition\u002Fland rights\u002FProperty requirements\u002FRefurbishments of workshops &amp; offices<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Appointment and management of specialists consultants and contractors<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Stakeholder management (internal and external to senior level)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Budget management including Financial Management and oversight (3rd parties fees, tenancy costs, Tax, dilapidations, etc…)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Knowledge &amp; Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Work Experience<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Degree and Chartered Surveyor with 5 to 10+ years relevant post qualification experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstrate knowledge and experience of property management in a utility or major land owner environment<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <ul>\n  <li> Experience of advising and providing technical information to senior management and experience of working with cross functional teams<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Personal Qualities<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Self-motivated with a “can-do” attitude, initiative and sound judgement<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Discreet and trustworthy<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Flexible in approach and interested in finding improved and innovative ways of managing the portfolio<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Committed to high standards and timely performance<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p> Skill Sets<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Demonstrate ability to plan, prioritise and work independently and on their own initiative and to tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong communication and negotiations with public, internal staff and at all levels <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrate ability to build and maintain relationship with tenants, landowners and other 3rd party (planning authorities, public, etc…)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to contribute to strategic discussions about the Estate<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> What we will offer you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> An expected starting life assurance worth 4 x annual salary <\u002Fli>\n  <li>25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, pro-rata<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Company Paid Private Medical Insurance for you and your family <\u002Fli>\n <p><b>RWE Supply &amp; Trading GmbH, Swindon<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, Full time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The Commercial Asset Management (“CAM”) function within RWE Supply &amp; Trading develops opportunities by connecting Generation, Trading and Grid Business combined with Market and Regulatory expertise.<\u002Fp>\n <p> In this environment, the UK Asset and Battery Development teams which are responsible for developing projects to financial close, are looking for a highly motivated flexible colleague with technical expertise in Power Grid connections. As the power grids are increasingly challenged to support a burgeoning range and volume of connections it is critical to be proactive and \"best-in-class\" in all technical and commercial aspects of grid connections in order to realise new asset development projects. Projects include standalone batteries, assets such as synchronous condensers providing essential services to Grid, flexible gas peaking plant and connecting RWE Generation assets to industrial\u002Fcommercial counterparts.<\u002Fp>\n <p> This is a great opportunity to use your technical and commercial strengths to help RWE facilitate the energy transition through managing all aspects of grid connection.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Your responsibilities <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>You are responsible for managing all aspects of the grid connection process with personal targets aligned with successful development of projects<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You will manage the end to end connection process:\n   <ul>\n    <li> Provide advice on strategy for connection applications: technical options for connection, cost estimate and strategy during application<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Coordinate across relevant RWE teams ansd functions during applications: ensure all information submitted is correct and in time. Resolve queries with Network Owners. Follow up with NO during the process ensuring satisfactory completion.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Manage the pipeline and track new connection\u002Fpre application queries.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Actively and autonomously drive DNO\u002FTNO to speed up processes. Working with the development team: negotiate and optimise solutions to find the lowest cost\u002Fhighest value connection option.<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Review connection offers and advise the development team summarising costs, scope of work, cashflows and options.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Manage development\u002Fscouting of new connections\n   <ul>\n    <li> Due diligence of grid connection contracts from 3rd parties during acquisition<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Risk analysis of ModApps. Connection date\u002Ftechnology and provide advice on cost and cashflows involved on the process<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n  <li> Analysis of National Grid and DNO publications and provide advice regarding future needs for locational stability services, analysis of targeted locations.\n   <ul>\n    <li> Review and report on Network Options Assessments, Operability Reports and 10 year statements from National Grid<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Review development plans from DNOs\u002FTNOs<\u002Fli>\n    <li> Act as key contact for teams (internal and external) performing Grid\u002FPower Flow modelling - supplying \"local\" knowledge and able to help inform modelling approach.<\u002Fli>\n   <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Your profile <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Grid connections expert with a proven track record of taking ownership of relevant activities and “making things work”<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to thrive in a team environment and strive for transparency and collaboration with integrity, openness, willingness for change and trust<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in identifying opportunities, analysing requirements and developing technical and commercial solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in UK energy market with Grid Code expertise and the ability to translate regulatory changes into business opportunities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> University degree in Physics, Mathematics or Electrical Engineering with experience in a technical environment<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent command of English (negotiating level)<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Our offer <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>Work in an experienced team which will support you in your development<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Gain excellent insights into both the Supply and Trading and RWE Generation businesses<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Your successful projects will help in facilitate the transition for RWE to 2040 net zero CO2<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Competitive salary, and annual bonus pay<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Various flexible company benefits<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> rwe.com\u002Fcareer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code <b>79258.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Any questions? Approximately 1,700 employees from over 50 different countries trade (renewable) electricity, (green) gas, commodities and CO2 emission allowances. The trading entity also ensures the commercial optimisation of RWE’s power plant dispatch and markets electricity from We are involved in various national and international Power2X and X2Power building projects and cover all project phases, from project development to turnkey handover. This includes new construction projects for hydrogen-ready power plants, hydrogen electrolysers, LNG and ammonia terminals.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Key Responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li>
