<p><b>RWE Offshore Wind GmbH<\u002Fb><b>, <\u002Fb><b>Essen, Hamburg, Swindon, Coventry, London, Austin, Barcelona, Chicago, Madrid, Paris, Rome, Warszawa, Milano, Tokyo, Melbourne<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> To start as soon as possible, <\u002Fb><b>Full time<\u002Fb><b>, <\u002Fb><b>Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Functional area:<\u002Fb> Commercial \u002F Trading<\u002Fp>\n <p> The Team Lead Quantitative Methods will lead the Quantitative Methods team in Global Modelling &amp; Methods in the RWE Renewables Commercial Analysis Department. The Global Modelling &amp; Methods team is responsible for all quantitative modelling activities within RWE Renewables Commercial area including developing, running and maintaining a range of consistent and best-in-class renewables and energy storage portfolio optimisation, risk analysis, pricing and forecasting models, covering all RWE Renewables markets in Americas, EU and APAC (Asia Pacific), as such the role offers the opportunity for the right candidate to travel regularly to different business regions, and work among a diverse range of cultures.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Among the key responsibilities of the role will be responsibility for the modelling of commercial revenue streams of energy storage technologies, mainly battery storages, stand alone or paired with renewable assets, covering both long term for investment decision support and short term for asset commercialisation in all core and future markets of RWE Renewables.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Another main responsibility of the role will be leading the development models and methods for modelling Ancillary Service, imbalance, and Intraday markets. This work enables us to quantify the impact of regulatory changes on RWE Renewables portfolio revenues, and value new investments in renewable energy assets, Onshore and Offshore Wind, PV, and Storage.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The role holder will have the responsibility to embed these models and methods across the global business, working with local regional stakeholders. Alignment with other regional operations (Europe, Americas, APAC), Group Centre as well as the local business in Spain will be necessary to fulfil these responsibilities.<\u002Fp>\n <p> The role holder should be able to transform the results of complex quantitative analysis into easily understandable recommendations and deliver to senior stakeholders ensuring well-grounded, model driven decisions. The role has a direct impact on implementation of commercial strategies regarding hedging of RWE renewables portfolio, optimal asset \u002F location selection for both investment and divestment decisions.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Principal Accountabilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Lead the quantitative support and model driven recommendations for final investment decisions (FIDs), power purchase agreements (PPAs) and M&amp;A transactions.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead on the analysis, development &amp; maintenance of algorithms and optimisation models for renewables portfolio, standalone or hybrid battery storage revenues using linear\u002Fnon-linear programming techniques.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Recruitment, and development of a team of quantitative analysts.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Lead Project work streams regarding commercial portfolio strategy.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Evaluate commercial opportunities of new emerging technologies such as Hydrogen and Power-to-X and their impact of RWE Renewables portfolio revenues with bespoke fundamental \u002F econometric models.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Work with Group and Renewables Risk Controlling to ensure that developed models are certified, well documented and best in class.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Research new methodologies and areas of model applications and identify potential improvements to current models, ensure new code meets the team standards for production. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Support Commercial Functions (Commercial Analysis, Structured Origination, Optimisation, and CCO) with ad-hoc modelling and commercial expertise.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Required Skills &amp; Competencies<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Undergraduate degree in an analytical \u002F numerical subject, preferably Operations Research, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics. (Masters’ or PhD degree would be advantageous)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Excellent analytical and problem solving skills, attention to detail and strong mathematical understanding.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Willingness to travel regularly, to other regional locations and group centre in Germany.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Very strong Excel i.e. should be able to use all excel functionality at an expert level, writing macros and VBA Functions, integrating excel with external data sources. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Demonstrable development experience using one of: Python, R, Matlab, C\u002FC++, Go, Julia, with an emphasis on data analysis and modelling, in a professional or academic background.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Several years of relevant academic or professional experience in a position developing models focused on optimisation, quantitative finance, or data science in finance or energy sectors.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong interpersonal and presentational skills (expert user of PowerPoint) plus ability to deal with uncertainty linked to cross-cultural projects.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Effective written and verbal communication skills; fluency in English (verbal and written) is essential. (A second language would be advantageous)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to explain and defend the methodology used in the development of quantitative models and tools.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Highly proactive, identifying value opportunities and proposing solutions to them under own initiative.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> rwe.com\u002Fcareer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Apply now with just a few clicks: ad code <b>79447<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Any questions? Christopher Kretschmann, christopher.kretschmann.extern@rwe.com<\u002Fp>\n <p> We look forward to receiving your application!<\u002Fp>\n <p> We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications, irrespective of gender, disability, nationality, ethnic and social background, religion and beliefs, age or sexual orientation and identity.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Of course, you can find us on LinkedIn, Twitter and Xing, too.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Renewables is the future of our business, and Offshore wind a pivotal element of our carbon neutral ambition. With 800+ fixed bottom and floating turbines – plus others totalling 800MWh we operate for partners – we’re already the No.2 generator globally. And we plan to triple our 2.2GWh output by 2030, led by landmark projects such as Sofia (1,400 MWh) and Kaskasi (342MWh). Offshore wind is a constantly evolving technical, practical and social challenge. Our financial stability means you’ll have the freedom to act with conviction and courage as we pivot to harness new technologies – and continuously improve, <p><b>RWE Supply &amp; Trading GmbH<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Start zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt, Vollzeit, unbefristet<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Deine Zukunftspläne<\u002Fb><br> Als 2nd Level Support Network Engineer nimmst du bei RWE Supply &amp; Trading GmbH (RWEST) eine zentrale Rolle dabei ein, das Netzwerk zukunftssicher für den gesamten RWE Konzern an über 250 Standorten zu betreiben. Für die Umsetzung der unternehmensspezifischen Netzwerk-Architektur und -Strategie suchen wir dich und deine Expertise, um zusammen mit internen und externen Partnern und Providern die Netzwerklandschaft fortlaufend an den strategischen Zielen der Gruppe auszurichten.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Du wirst Teil der Abteilung \"Connectivity &amp; Network Peripherals\", die den Bereich Netzwerk und Netzwerksicherheit, incl. 2nd und 3rd Level verantworten. Das Spektrum umfasst nicht nur Betrieb, Wartung und Support, sondern auch Entwurf, Implementierung und Weiterentwicklung der Infrastruktur projektbasiert für den ganzen Konzern.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Als 2nd Level Support Network Engineer bist du für den Betrieb der RWE weiten Netzwerk-Services mit hohen Latenz- Sicherheits- und Stabilitätsanforderungen gemeinsam mit den RWE Providern und Partnern verantwortlich.<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Die technische und methodische Weiterentwicklung, sowie Störungsannahme und -bearbeitung im Rahmen des 2nd Level Supports (Netzwerk, Security) für interne und externe Kunden<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Implementierung von Network-Security-Regeln anhand bestehender Prozesse<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Kommunikation mit vor- und nachgelagerten Support-Levels<\u002Fli>\n  <li> time, Permanent<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Your responsibilities<\u002Fb><br> As a Portfolio Commercial &amp; Performance Engineer you will continuously work on the delivery of “best in class\" technical and commercial performance across our pan-European gas fleet with over 12,000 MWs of generating capacity in the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Germany.<br> As our gas stations compete in a very volatile energy market which requires optimal performance on technical capabilities and availability to realise the best value add for the portfolio, this role is key for driving and supporting short to medium term commercial optimisation. This involves not only performance, but also the optimal positioning of outages as well as mitigating actions to reduce cost of breakdowns and unplanned maintenance.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li><br> Engaging with site-based Commercial &amp; Performance Engineers, Operations &amp; Maintenance O&amp;M, Engineering &amp; Outage (E&amp;O) Teams and RWE Supply &amp; Trading Commercial Asset Optimisation (CAO) to encourage good short - to mid-term commercial decision making through continuous challenge and ensuring consistency across the fleet<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Establish best practices for continuously monitoring asset performance to identify variances and develop strategies for improvement as well as in case of shortfall<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Constant monitoring of dispatch relevant technical data to ensure that CAO always dispatches and trades on the best and most up-to-date available information on stations’ technical capabilities<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Identify and lead portfolio wide or asset specific projects to improve asset performance that require strong management of change and bring them successfully to completion<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Support the development and make use of new digital tools and approaches to analyse large amounts of data<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Provide knowledge share and development in plant technical and commercial performance of asset-based Commercial &amp; Performance engineers and O&amp;M staff<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b><br> Your profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Technical \u002F engineering qualification at degree level or equivalent<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A technical insight into power plant processes and thermodynamics, knowledge of the energy market<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of commercial operation and trading in the power, fuel and CO2 markets or willingness to learn<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of plant testing, monitoring, reporting and analysis leading to quantified improvements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong analytical and conceptual skills to assess complex situations and derive solutions<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Digital affinity; using new tools and approaches to analyse large amounts of data<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to network, develop and maintain positive personal relationships on different levels in an international environment and an ability to confidently engage with stakeholders<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A team player with an open constructive attitude as well as the willingness to learn and develop new skills and flexibility to take on new tasks<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Constructively managing strong differences in opinion to positive solutions and the ability to establish, develop and lead cross-functional and international teams<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Business fluent in English as well as German or Dutch<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Willingness to travel because the role can be based at any other location in Germany, the Netherlands or the UK with the flexibility to travel to other locations<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Advantageous, but not a must<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Knowledge of thermodynamic modelling<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> What we offer<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> At RWE, you will find all the advantages of a large technology group. The company ranks second in Europe with its gas-fired power plants. An excellent starting position, as gas is becoming more and more important as a bridge into the renewable age. Could be located in either Essen (Germany), London (UK) or Swindon (UK), with some travel between sites required. Although the role is full-time, we do have some degree of flex with working times – we are happy to discuss this at the interview stage.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> It’s an exciting time to join us! RWEST is implementing and further developing a Data &amp; Analytics platform to make the sharing, searching, transforming and on-boarding of data simple and efficient. Data is fundamental to the company’s business model and will become an ever increasing asset in the future.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> As part of an expanding multi-disciplinary team of 30 engineers you will play a key role in the company wide initiative. We are developing and enhancing a cloud-based platform and infrastructure using the latest tech, capable of cleaning, transforming and efficiently accessing data, running on-demand as well as scheduled models, and integrating with pre-existing technology.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> The initiative is sponsored by the Board and is a key enabler for the company’s commercial strategy. Therefore, we are looking for an experienced individual to join us. Someone who will play a key role in shaping the platform as we scale it, influencing how it is built and the technical decisions we take. If this sounds appealing, then apply now!<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> As part of your role as an interdisciplinary Data Engineer, you will:<\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Take ownership of the technical design of our Data &amp; Analytics platform covering the aspects integration of new use cases, robustness, performance, data latency, availability and maintainability of our strategic data platform<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Shape and influence the technical delivery backlog with new ideas and enhancements and technical requirements<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Act as the interface between the ~ 600 business trading users; Support business users to best leverage the Data &amp; Analytics platform; Translate business requirements into a technical design<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be a member of a multidisciplinary team of Data Engineers and DevOps Engineers delivering features and enhancements for our platform<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Monitor that the right quality assurance processes are in place; You propose and work on improvements where indicated<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Want to work in a supportive collaborative environment focused on delivering value to our users<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be a specialist for one of our key components DataBricks, Dremio and\u002For Alation<\u002Fli>\n  <li> You have an in depth understanding of data flows and integrate data flows from surrounding systems using state of the art technologies<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Be a real technical problem solver, able to create solutions for complex requirements with a hands-on attitude<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Keep up to date with new trends in Data Analysics tools always looking to new solutions to solve complex problems<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Your powerful skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Proven experience in the mentioned technical skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Fluent in English (verbal and written)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A degree in, or related to Computer Science or equivalent experience<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience in building, operating and\u002For supporting robust and scalable big data platforms<\u002Fli>\n  <li> The ability to translate business requirements into a technical design. In-house and by third parties.<\u002Fp>\n <p> This role provides an excellent opportunity for a highly motivated, analytical individual. timely conclusion<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Collaborate and work with embedded colleagues in different offices \u002F timezones<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Your profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Strong knowledge of Microsoft .NET technologies (in particular C#, ASP.NET) and Databases (Oracle, MS SQLServer, but also No-SQL technologies like MongoDB)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Python\u002FSpark<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Previous experience of developing and supporting front office applications<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A good understanding of the European and Asian energy markets.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Knowledge of the trade life cycle process and experience of working in an Energy Trading environment.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Able to demonstrate a thorough understanding of the business processes of RWE Supply &amp; On growth markets outside Europe, especially in the Asia-Pacific region, we are the hub for electricity, gas, biomass, raw materials and emission certificates. We provide large industrial companies and trading partners with energy supply solutions and risk management concepts. We also ensure commercial optimisation of the RWE power stations, operate storage for natural gas and market renewable energy generated by RWE Renewables. <p> Contract Type – Permanent<\u002Fp>\n <p> Working Hours – Full Time<\u002Fp>\n <p> Closing Date – 20 January 2023<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Who is RWE?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE Generation is responsible for power generation with gas, hard coal, hydrogen, hydropower and biomass. Our approximately 3,000 employees operate power plants in Germany, Great Britain, the Netherlands and Turkey.<\u002Fp>\n <p> With our flexible, efficient power plant fleet, we are building the bridge for the path to the age of renewable energies. RWE Generation ranks 2nd in Europe with its gas fleet. An excellent starting position: Gas is becoming increasingly important as a bridge to the regenerative age.<\u002Fp>\n <p> In the UK, RWE is one of the largest power producers and a leading renewable generator supplying around 15% of UK electricity with a diverse operational portfolio of onshore wind, offshore wind, hydro, biomass and gas, amounting to over 9.3GW.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> What is Engineering &amp; Outage?<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> The Engineering &amp; Outage division in RWE Generation Gas is responsible for central engineering services to our Gas Power Stations across Europe in addition to determine the scope of a major outage and large investment projects. Services and projects covers the whole Power Station be this the Gas Turbine, Steam Turbine, Heat Recovery Steam Generator, Electrical Generator, Civil Infrastructure, Control &amp; Instrumental Systems and even the important auxiliary systems such as Cooling Towers, Pumps and Valves all integral for safe, flexible and reliable operation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Role Location – Swindon or UK Gas Power Site (travel through-out the UK expected)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE’s Mechanical &amp; Materials is an international team in Engineering &amp; Outage we want to strengthen our core static mechanical engineering competence to deliver engineering services in the UK. You will be a focused individual who can co-ordinate several work streams and can keep stakeholders informed. You will also share your experience with your German and Dutch civil colleagues where appropriate.<\u002Fp>\n <p> You would join a friendly team of around 20 professional engineers\u002Fscientists, with varying backgrounds including mechanical engineering, materials\u002Fmetallurgy, physics, civil engineering and chemistry. The team work collaboratively and support each other to meet the exciting challenge of keeping our gas-fired power plant reliable and efficient. This supports RWE’s goal of being carbon neutral by 2040. <\u002Fp>\n <p>Join our team to contribute to a sustainable energy transition and shape the UK’s low carbon flexible landscape.<\u002Fp>\n <p><b> Main Purpose of the Role<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> Your role is to provide mechanical engineering expertise to the RWE gas power station fleet. You will be responsible for technical delivery of projects and tasks, resolving emergent technical issues and contribute to meeting UK Pressure Systems Safety Regulations (PSSR) requirements through the Technical Review process. You will be conscientious, self-motivated and enthusiastic.<\u002Fp>\n <p> Your safety behaviours will be exemplary and you will develop the capability to work to independently and take individual responsibility for your technical decisions. <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Key Responsibilities<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Implementation of consistent HRSG and BOP engineering and maintenance strategies to deliver portfolio performance in line with individual asset strategies.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Produce Technical Reviews to support PSSR requirements.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Develop outage scope and assist in delivery at site.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Undertake supporting projects for effective component life management.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Co-ordinate tasks with gas power plant operational sites.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Knowledge &amp; Skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Degree or suitable alternative in Mechanical Engineering. <\u002Fli>\n  <li>Chartered Engineer or actively progressing towards Chartered status.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Effective at stakeholder management to maintain proactive working relationships.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Experience of heat recovery steam generators and balance of plant engineering issues.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Demonstration of complex thinking , including both analytical and conceptual skills<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Organisation and planning abilities.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ability to use analysis tools (e.g. plant data analysis, root cause analysis, design tools)<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Sound written and verbal communication skills.<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Use of standard Microsoft software including Excel.<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b><br> What we will offer you<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> A competitive salary depending on experience and up to 15% annual bonus<\u002Fli>\n  <li> A personal retirement savings plan – if you put in 5% we will top up by a further 10% and you will get life assurance worth 4 x annual salary <\u002Fli>\n  <li>25 days annual leave plus bank holidays, pro-rata<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Company Paid Private Medical Insurance for you and your family<\u002Fli>\n  <li> One free professional membership subscription<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to flexible benefits such as Critical Illness, Dental Plan, Health Cash Plan, Share Incentive Plan, Cycle2Work, Electric Car Lease Scheme, Buy Additional Annual Leave and retail savings scheme<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Occupational Health support services for your wellbeing<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Access to our employee assistance programme in times of need<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Up to 2 days volunteering a year<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><br> To view a preview of our benefits site ‘YourHub’ and see some of the other benefits we have on offer please visit https:\u002F\u002Fwww.edenred.co.uk\u002Fcampaigns\u002Frwe-yourhub\u002Findex.html<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Working at RWE<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> To find out more about what it’s like to work at one of Europe’s largest energy companies and what we are all about we have a wealth of information on our Careers pages. https:\u002F\u002Fwww.rwe.com\u002Fen\u002Frwe-careers-portal <\u002Fp>\n <p>Here you can meet some of the team, find out more about Diversity at RWE, what your onboarding will look like and some FAQs.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p><b>Equal Opportunities <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p>We value diversity and therefore welcome all applications, irrespective of gender, disability, nationality, ethnic and social background, religion and beliefs, age or sexual orientation and identity.<\u002Fp>\n <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n <p>We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> Our energy for a sustainable life<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> RWE represents change, innovation and sustainability. As one of the world’s leading generators of electricity from renewable energy sources, we aim to be carbon-neutral by 2040 and to enable a sustainable life for people around the world. To achieve this, we are looking for dynamic and motivated people to join us in creating a sustainable and secure energy future.<\u002Fp>\n <p><\u002Fp>\n <p><b><br> RWE in the UK<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <p> We operate a large and diverse portfolio of power generation assets in the UK. We are the UK’s second largest generator of thermal flexible capacity, supplying around 10% of the UK’s electricity last year with 8.6GW of installed capacity. The portfolio includes the UK’s largest fleet of gas-fired power stations, along with a small amount of Biomass and Hydro Data Centre service<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Review the Cloud &amp; Data Centre utilisation reports and agree on monthly volumes and charges<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Ensure all appropriate 3rd party Supplier processes are consistent and align with all appropriate existing RWE IT’s processes<\u002Fli>\n  <li> Facilitate time-sensitive problem resolution of contractual issues to minimise impact of service disruptions on customers<\u002Fli>\n <\u002Ful>\n <p><b> Your powerful skills<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n <ul>\n  <li> Experience of managing the performance of Cloud &amp;
